text: The system shall be used within the specifications defined by the computers used by the Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Use Aligns with Specified Hardware Capabilities

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to ensure that the system is used within the specifications defined by the computers, to maintain system reliability, avoid harm due to technical issues, and ensure the system performs effectively to benefit both staff and patients. This adherence promotes transparency, responsibility, justice and fairness, and builds trust in the system's operations.

text: The system shall operate within the Windows XP Professional operating system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: System Compatibility with Legacy Operating Systems

**Description**: As a product owner, I want the system to be compatible with Windows XP Professional, ensuring that users who operate on older systems can access essential services without coercing them to upgrade, aligned with the principles of justice and fairness, as well as beneficence. This approach ensures inclusivity and benefits a broader scope of users while upholding their autonomy.

text: The system shall interface with CampusConnect\92s central server
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Interface with CampusConnect's Central Server

**Description**: Ensure that the system's interface with CampusConnect's central server adheres to principles of privacy, security, and transparency. The connection must securely transmit data, protect personal information, and clearly communicate data usage policies to stakeholders to foster trust and uphold user dignity. Additionally, regularly audit and document these interactions to maintain accountability and integrity.

text: The system shall interface with the faculty central server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Secure Server Interface

**Description**: As a system designer, I want the system to interface with the faculty central server in a transparent and secure manner to ensure that data transactions are clear, understandable, and protected, thereby building trust and maintaining privacy.

text: The system shall interface with the student master server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure Interface with Student Master Server

**Description**: As a system developer, I want to ensure that interfacing with the student master server is conducted in a secure, transparent, and privacy-respecting manner, to maintain data integrity, protect student privacy, and build trust among users.

text: We must be able to interface with any HTML browser.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Universal Browser Accessibility

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to interface with any HTML browser to ensure transparency and accessibility for all, respecting freedom and autonomy by allowing users to choose their preferred browser without restrictions.

text: Only authorized users shall have access to clinical site information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Restricted Access to Clinical Site Information

**Description**: As an ethical requirement, access to sensitive clinical site information shall be restricted to only authorized users in order to ensure privacy, maintain trust, and uphold the dignity of individuals whose data is being protected. This measure prevents unauthorized access which could lead to potential harm, breaches of confidentiality, and misuse of personal data.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members are the only people who shall have access to clinical site details.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restrict Access to Clinical Site Details to Authorized Personnel

**Description**: As part of ensuring privacy and maintaining trust, only program administrators and nursing staff members shall have access to clinical site details. This restriction safeguards patient information and upholds the non-maleficence principle by preventing unauthorized access that could cause harm.

text: Dr Susan Poslusny and Dr Julie Donalek are the only people who shall have access to students\92 personal information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Access to Students' Personal Information

**Description**: As a trusted educational institution, we ensure that only authorized personnel, specifically Dr. Susan Poslusny and Dr. Julie Donalek, have access to students' personal information to protect privacy and maintain trust.

text: Only authorized users shall have access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Access Control for CampusConnect Interface

**Description**: Ensure that only authorized users have access to the portion of the system that interfaces with CampusConnect. This will protect user privacy by preventing unauthorized access to potentially sensitive campus-related data, uphold the responsibility of developers in safeguarding data integrity, and build trust by ensuring that access protocols are robust and reliable.

text: Fit Criterion: Dr Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol are the only people who shall have access to the final class section scheduling for the system that interfaces with CampusConnect.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Exclusive Access to Final Class Section Scheduling

**Description**: Implement access controls in the system interfacing with CampusConnect to ensure that only Dr. Susan Poslusny and Karen Sysol have the permissions to access the final class section scheduling, thereby upholding privacy and preventing unauthorized access.

text: The system shall use the organization\92s standard virus protection software to help monitor threats to itself.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Virus Protection Compliance

**Description**: As an organization, we commit to incorporating and regularly updating our standard virus protection software within our systems to safeguard against potential threats, thereby ensuring a secure and trustworthy environment for our users. This initiative aligns with our responsibility to protect user data and maintain system integrity.

text: A cohort shall be associated to one Program of Study offered by the department.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Associate Cohort to Program of Study

**Description**: As an educational institution, we need to ensure that a cohort is correctly associated with a specific Program of Study offered by the department to maintain clarity and accuracy in academic administration. This promotes transparency and fairness by ensuring that students have a clear understanding of their course structure and academic requirements. It also upholds the principles of responsibility and trust by ensuring accurate and reliable data management, thereby protecting students’ educational expectations and privacy.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a listing of students to a cohort.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Transparent Student Cohort Assignment by Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to be able to add a listing of students to a cohort in an unbiased, transparent manner to ensure fairness and uphold the trust and dignity of all students. The process must include clear documentation and communication to all stakeholders, guaranteeing non-maleficence and justice. Additionally, mechanisms will be in place to ensure privacy and the responsible handling of personal data.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a single student to a cohort
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Transparent Process for Adding a Student to a Cohort

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want the process of adding a single student to a cohort to be transparent, fair, and non-discriminatory, ensuring that all actions are accountable and respectful of the student's dignity, in order to maintain trust and uphold ethical standards.

text: Students added to a cohort shall be eligible for the cohort\92s Program of Study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair Eligibility for Cohort Programs

**Description**: As a system designer, I want to ensure that all students added to a cohort are eligible for the cohort's Program of Study in a fair and transparent manner, respecting their dignity and privacy, and upholding justice and fairness. This will help prevent discrimination and ensure that all students have equal access to educational opportunities.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Ethical Course Sequencing for Nursing Cohorts

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I need to specify the preferred sequence of classes for a given cohort in a way that ensures transparency and fairness, avoids causing any harm, respects privacy and autonomy, and promotes trust, sustainability, and beneficence within the educational environment. This sequence will be communicated clearly and justly to all students involved, safeguarding their dignity and ensuring equal opportunities for all.

text: For each class within a sequence for a cohort  Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to specify which quarter that class will be offered.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Responsible Class Scheduling

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to transparently specify the quarter in which each class will be offered for a cohort, ensuring that the scheduling process is clear, accountable, and just. This ethical user story ensures that all stakeholders are informed and can trust the schedule, promoting fairness and responsibility in educational program administration.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes to a sequence of classes
ethical_us:
**Title**: Facilitate Class Addition with Ethical Considerations

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add new classes to a sequence of classes transparently and responsibly. This functionality should respect students' privacy by safeguarding their data, ensure non-maleficence by not overburdening students, promote beneficence by enhancing educational opportunities, and maintain fairness by providing equal opportunities for all students. Additionally, the system should ensure sustainability in terms of resource use and trustworthiness in data handling.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Addition of Clinical Classes or Sections by Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to add clinical classes or sections to a sequence of classes in a way that ensures transparency in the process, maintains privacy of student and patient data, upholds the principles of non-maleficence and beneficence by ensuring the changes benefit all stakeholders and cause no harm, respects the autonomy of the nursing students, guarantees the fair and just allocation of resources, and builds trust in the system's reliability and integrity.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new cohort to the system  identified by start month and year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Addition of New Cohorts by Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a new cohort to the system, identified by start month and year, ensuring that this process is transparent, respects user privacy, promotes beneficence by improving workflow efficiency, and maintains trust through secure data handling.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add new classes for the nursing department into the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Addition of New Nursing Classes

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to ensure that when adding new classes for the nursing department into the system, the process respects all ethical principles. This includes maintaining data privacy, ensuring transparency and fairness in the class creation process, promoting beneficence by providing high-quality educational opportunities, and upholding the dignity and autonomy of all participants. The system must be designed to avoid any potential harm, distributed justly, and built sustainably to ensure long-term trustworthiness.

text: A class shall be either a non-clinical class or a clinical class.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Clear Classification of Classes

**Description**: As a user, I need the system to clearly distinguish between non-clinical and clinical classes to ensure transparency and trust, thereby preventing any misinterpretation or misuse that could lead to harm. This clear classification will support the responsible and ethical management of class content, ensuring that users receive appropriate and beneficial information without compromising their autonomy or privacy.

text: A non-clinical class shall specify the course name  lecture room requirements  and instructor needs.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Responsible Allocation of Course Resources

**Description**: As a university administrator, I want to transparently specify the course name, lecture room requirements, and instructor needs for a non-clinical class to ensure clear communication, resource allocation, and institutional accountability, thereby upholding principles of transparency and responsibility.

text: A clinical class shall specify the course name  lecture room requirements  clinical site needs  lecture instructor needs  and clinical lab instructor needs.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Specification of Clinical Class Requirements

**Description**: As an educational institution responsible for designing clinical classes, we aim to transparently specify the course name, lecture room requirements, clinical site needs, lecture instructor needs, and clinical lab instructor needs. In doing so, we ensure that all stakeholders—students, instructors, and clinical sites—are fully informed and can participate in the decision-making process, respecting their autonomy and dignity. This transparency also supports trust and responsibility by making clear the needs and commitments of each party involved.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to create a new Program of Study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Creation of New Programs of Study

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to create a new Program of Study in a manner that ensures transparency in the design and objectives of the program, respects the privacy of involved stakeholders, and fosters trust by ensuring the program is beneficial, fair, and upholds the dignity and autonomy of all participants. This will allow the institution to responsibly develop programs that are sustainable and without causing harm to individuals or communities.

text: A Program of Study shall consist of a program name and listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) that must be completed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparency and Fair Structure in Program of Study

**Description**: As a user, I want the Program of Study to clearly consist of a program name and a comprehensive listing of required classes (both clinical and non-clinical) so that I have full transparency about the course requirements and can plan my academic journey without encountering unexpected constraints or unclear information. This will promote fairness and allow me to make informed decisions regarding my education.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Role-specific Access to Program Requirements Management

**Description**: As a healthcare education platform developer, I want to ensure that only Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members have the ability to specify which classes are required for a Program of Study, so that role-specific responsibilities are upheld, privacy is maintained, and unauthorized changes that could cause harm or misinformation are prevented. This aligns with ethical principles of privacy, non-maleficence, and responsibility by ensuring that only those qualified for making such decisions have the access to perform these actions.

text: The system shall be able to display a report of needed classes for a given quarter for all cohorts of all programs for Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members\92 planning purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Course Requirement Reporting for Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the system to transparently display a report of required classes for all cohorts and programs for a given quarter, so that I can effectively plan and allocate resources, ensuring fairness and clarity in class scheduling and availability.

text: The report of needed classes shall include (but not be limited to) classes to be offered  number of sections needed  number of labs needed  and room types needed.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Fair Class Report Generation

**Description**: As an administrator overseeing the scheduling of academic classes, I want the report generation system to transparently include comprehensive details such as classes to be offered, the number of sections needed, the number of labs needed, and the types of rooms required. This ensures that the scheduling process is fair, understandable, and provides all necessary information for making equitable decisions, thereby promoting transparency and fairness.

text: Classes for a given cohort shall not conflict with regards to the time and day that they are offered.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Non-conflicting Class Schedules for Cohorts

**Description**: As an educational institution, we must ensure that class schedules for a given cohort do not conflict with each other in terms of time and day. This ensures that students have the autonomy to attend all required classes without timing conflicts, promoting fairness and accessibility to education.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical site into the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Clinical Site Data  
**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want the ability to add a new clinical site into the system in a manner that ensures data privacy and respects the dignity of all parties involved. The process should maintain transparency, allowing for auditability and ensuring trust. It should also guarantee responsibility by providing clear accountability measures and maintain fairness by adhering to non-discriminatory practices.

text: Clinical site information shall include (but not be limited to) the name of the site  contact person  and contact information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Privacy in Clinical Site Information

**Description**: As a responsible developer, I want to ensure that the collection and storage of clinical site information, which includes the name of the site, contact person, and contact information, are handled with utmost privacy. This ensures that the personal data of contact persons is protected from unauthorized access and misuse, upholding the principle of privacy.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class into the System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Addition of Clinical Lab Sections by Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a new clinical lab section to an existing clinical class in a manner that ensures transparency, data privacy, and fairness. This process should not harm the participants, should respect their dignity and autonomy, and must be executed responsibly. The system should also be designed to foster trust among users and benefit the overall educational and clinical community.

text: A clinical lab section shall include the clinical site name  the class  instructor  day and time of the lab.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Respectful Clinical Lab Information Display

**Description**: As a stakeholder in the academic scheduling system, I want the clinical lab section to transparently display the clinical site name, class, instructor, day, and time of the lab, ensuring that all relevant information is accessible and accurate. This transparency respects the dignity of students and instructors, ensures fairness in scheduling, and builds trust by providing clear and reliable information.

text: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members shall be able to add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section for that class.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Student Clinical Lab Assignments

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want to ethically add a student who has registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section, ensuring transparency, fairness, and respect for the student's privacy and autonomy, while also providing a secure and trustworthy process that supports the students' educational and professional development in a responsible and beneficial manner.

text: The system shall allow a Program Administrator or Nursing staff member to remove a student from a clinical lab section.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ethical Removal of Student from Clinical Lab Section

**Description:** As a Program Administrator or Nursing staff member, I need the ability to remove a student from a clinical lab section in a manner that ensures transparency, maintains the dignity of the student, and is communicated clearly to all affected parties. This process should involve clear documentation of the reasons for removal, protect the student's privacy, and ensure that the decision is fair, non-discriminatory, and justifiable to maintain trust within the educational program. The system should also provide mechanisms for accountability and avenues for the student to appeal or understand the decision fully.

text: The system shall allow a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member to move a student from one clinical lab section to another clinical lab section corresponding to the same clinical class.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ethical Management of Student Clinical Lab Assignments

**Description:** 
As a Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member, I want to be able to move a student from one clinical lab section to another corresponding to the same clinical class, while ensuring the process is transparent, respects the student's privacy, upholds fairness, and maintains the dignity and trust of all involved participants.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall be able to cancel a clinical lab section only if there are no students registered for that clinical lab section.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Handling of Clinical Lab Section Cancellations 

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to cancel a clinical lab section only if there are no students registered for that section, ensuring transparency and fairness. This will prevent disrupting students' schedules and maintain the integrity of the program's operations, fostering trust and responsibility toward students.

text: A Program Administrator/Nursing Staff Member shall be able to add a new nursing student to the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Addition of New Nursing Student to System  

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want to add a new nursing student to the system in a manner that ensures their privacy, dignity, and autonomy are respected, with transparent communication about how their data will be used and stored, so that they can trust the integrity and security of the system, and be confident in their equitable treatment within the program.

text: A staff member shall have the ability to manage the progress of a part time student  which includes modifying their sequence of classes and timeline of classes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Part-Time Student Progress

**Description**: As a staff member managing the progress of a part-time student, I want to modify their sequence and timeline of classes while ensuring transparency in the process, protecting the student's privacy and autonomy, and promoting fairness and justice in the scheduling decisions. This will allow me to support the student's academic journey responsibly and ethically.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual cohorts  which will include the students enlisted  the Program of study  sequence of classes  cohort progress through the program  and timeline of completion.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Display of Cohort Information Summary

**Description**: As an educational institution, we aim to provide a printable summary for individual cohorts that includes students enlisted, program of study, sequence of classes, cohort progress through the program, and timeline of completion. This functionality will be designed with the utmost respect for student privacy, ensuring that personal data is securely handled and only accessible to authorized users. Transparency in processing, and integrity in the representation of data, will be maintained to build trust and ensure the information is used responsibly to benefit the students and the institution.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical sites  which will include information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter (Clinical site  general information on labs held at that location  dates and times of all labs held there).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparency in Clinical Site Lab Summaries

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to display a printable summary for individual clinical sites that includes information on labs being held at that site for the given quarter. This summary should transparently provide clinical site general information, dates, and times of all labs held there, ensuring clarity and understandability for all stakeholders involved.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual clinical labs  which will include (but not be limited to) class name  class number  lab section  listing of students enrolled  instructor  day(s)  time  and location.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Display and Summary of Clinical Lab Information

**Description**: As a system, I should display a printable summary for individual clinical labs that includes class name, class number, lab section, listing of students enrolled, instructor, day(s), time, and location, ensuring that the data privacy of all individuals involved is protected and the information is presented in a transparent, fair, and understandable manner. This summary should also respect the dignity of the individuals by securing sensitive information and ensuring the proper use of data, thus fostering trust in the system's integrity and its commitment to responsible and ethical information handling.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary for individual nursing students  which will include (but not be limited to) student name  student ID  admission date  classes  credits  GPA  and the cohort that the student is enrolled in.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent and Privacy-Respectful Printable Summaries

**Description**: As a system developer, I want the system to display printable summaries for individual nursing students that include student name, student ID, admission date, classes, credits, GPA, and cohort enrollment, ensuring transparency in presented information and respect for student privacy.

text: The system shall be able to display a printable summary of the system log.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent System Logging

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a printable summary of the system log so that I can easily access and review the activities and operations, ensuring transparency and accountability in the system's functioning. This helps build trust by maintaining clear and understandable records of the system's actions.

text: The system shall contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all people relevant to the system  including (but not limited to) staff members  students  lecture instructors  clinical lab instructors  and clinical site administrators.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Handling of Contact Information

**Description**: As a system user, I want the system to contain contact information (e-mail and phone number) for all relevant people including staff members, students, lecture instructors, clinical lab instructors, and clinical site administrators, while ensuring the privacy and dignity of individuals are upheld by protecting their personal data and obtaining appropriate consent.

text: The system will use the stored e-mail addresses as a primary means of communicating information to affected parties.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Responsible Communication through E-mail

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to use stored e-mail addresses as the primary means of communicating information to affected parties, ensuring that communication is transparent, responsible, and respects user privacy by securely handling and delivering messages accurately and promptly.

text: The system will notify affected parties for routine communication purposes  including but not limited to informing students of upcoming offered classes (timeline) and what their schedule will be/shall be.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Responsible Communication System

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to notify affected parties for routine communication purposes, including informing students of upcoming offered classes and their schedules, to ensure transparency and maintain the responsibility of providing timely and accurate information. This will help in building trust and allowing users to plan accordingly.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting clinicals  including but not limited to clinical section capacity changes  and clinical section cancellations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notification of Clinical Section Changes for Affected Parties

**Description**: As a system, I will notify affected parties promptly when changes occur that impact clinical operations, such as capacity changes or cancellations, in order to uphold transparency and responsibility, ensure trust, and protect the dignity and autonomy of those relying on accurate clinical information.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting classes  including but not limited to class cancellations  class section detail changes  and changes to class offerings for a given quarter.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Affected Parties of Class Changes

**Description**: The system will ensure transparency and respect for individual autonomy by notifying all affected parties promptly when there are changes to class schedules, including but not limited to cancellations, class section detail changes, and changes to class offerings for a given quarter, to prevent inconvenience and ensure fair access to information.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting cohorts  including but not limited to changes to the sequence for a cohort\92s program of study and changes to a given week\92s schedule (lab cancelled this week due to instructor illness).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Affected Parties of Program and Schedule Changes

**Description**: Ensure that the system transparently and responsibly notifies all affected parties when any changes occur impacting cohorts. This includes, but is not limited to, updates in the program sequence and weekly schedules such as lab cancellations due to instructor illness. By providing timely notifications, the system upholds principles of trust, responsibility, and fairness.

text: The system will notify affected parties when changes occur affecting specific students  including but not limited to changing a student\92s status from full time to part time and moving a student to a different clinical section.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Notification for Student Status Changes

**Description**: As an ethical requirement, the system shall ensure that it notifies affected parties transparently when changes occur affecting specific students, including but not limited to changing a student’s status from full-time to part-time and moving a student to a different clinical section. This notification must be clear, timely, and provide sufficient detail to understand the nature and reason for the change, ensuring accountability and fostering trust among students and stakeholders.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to cohorts including cohort identifier  program of study  preferred sequence of classes and quarters that a cohort will be taking specific classes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Cohort Information by Program Administrators and Nursing Staff

**Description**: 

- As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want the ability to securely and accurately modify information relating to cohorts—including cohort identifier, program of study, preferred sequence of classes, and quarters for specific classes—ensuring transparency and accountability in the data modification process. 
- This functionality should be designed to protect the privacy and autonomy of students while maintaining accuracy and integrity, to benefit the educational process without causing any harm or unfairness.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Program of Study within the Nursing Department including the Program of study name  and required classes for that Program of Study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Authorization for Modifying Nursing Programs

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the ability to modify information related to a Program of Study within the Nursing Department, including the Program of Study name and required classes, in a transparent and accountable manner. This ensures that changes are made responsibly, avoid any potential harm (non-maleficence), maintain the privacy of sensitive data, and uphold the dignity and trust of all relevant stakeholders. This process is conducted with fairness to all students and staff, ensuring that updates are both beneficial and free from discrimination.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Site  including the clinical site name  site contact person  contact information  and address.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Clinical Site Information

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I want the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Site, including the clinical site name, site contact person, contact information, and address, in a manner that ensures transparency, respects privacy, and maintains the integrity of the information. This will allow for accurate and responsible management of clinical site data, ensuring that all stakeholders have access to correct and updated information while safeguarding personal data and adhering to ethical standards.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Clinical Lab Section  including the clinical site name the department/section for the lab  the class instructor day and time of lab and contact information.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Modification of Clinical Lab Section Information

**Description**: As a Program Administrator or Nursing Staff Member, I should have the ability to modify information related to a Clinical Lab Section, including clinical site name, department/section for the lab, class instructor, day and time of lab, and contact information, ensuring transparency, responsibility, and adherence to privacy standards. This modification power should be balanced with safeguards that prevent harm, protect individual privacy, uphold trust, and promote fairness and justice in the handling of sensitive information.

text: Program Administrators/Nursing Staff Members shall have the ability to modify information relating to a Nursing Student  including student ID  student name phone number e-mail status (full time or part time) and program of study.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Information Management for Nursing Students

**Description**: As a program administrator or nursing staff member, I want the ability to modify information relating to a nursing student, including student ID, student name, phone number, e-mail, status (full-time or part-time), and program of study, in a manner that ensures transparency, privacy, and accountability. This ensures that all modifications are done responsibly and that students' personal data is protected while maintaining trust and upholding their dignity.

text: The Disputes application shall comply with the corporate standards for user interface creation for internally and externally used applications.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Interface Compliance with Corporate Standards

**Description**: As a developer, I want the Disputes application to comply with corporate standards for user interface creation, ensuring consistency and accessibility across both internally and externally used applications for all users, while upholding principles of justice and fairness, trust, and dignity.

text: All screens created as part of the Disputes application must comply with corporate standards for interface creation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compliance with Corporate Standards for Dispute Application Interfaces

**Description**: As a responsible developer, I want to ensure all screens created as part of the Disputes application comply with corporate standards for interface creation, so that they adhere to principles of transparency, non-maleficence, trust, and justice and fairness, and thus provide a secure, effective, and fair user experience.

text: The list of dispute cases that are displayed after a search is performed must be color coded for easy identification of dispute cases based upon the dispute case status.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Color-Coded Dispute Case Display for Easy Identification

**Description**: As a user searching for dispute cases, I want the list of dispute cases to be color-coded based on their status, ensuring swift and clear recognition of each case's state. This enhances accessibility and clarity, fostering transparency and trust in the system while promoting justice and fairness by ensuring all cases are equally recognizable regardless of their status.

text: 100% of the cardmember and merchant services representatives shall use the Disputes application regularly after a 2-day training course.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Fair Access and Competence in Application Use

**Description**: As a part of our commitment to justice and fairness, all cardmember and merchant services representatives should be equipped to use the Disputes application effectively and confidently after completing a comprehensive 2-day training course. This ensures that all representatives have equal access to the tools they need to perform their duties, preventing any unfair disadvantages and promoting competence across our team.

text: 100% of cardmember services representatives shall be able to successfully create a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Effective Dispute Case Creation by Cardmember Services Representatives

**Description**: As an organisation, we need to guarantee that 100% of cardmember services representatives are proficient in creating dispute cases on their first attempt post-training. This ensures the principles of justice and fairness by providing equitable service to all clients. It also promotes trust by ensuring that representatives are properly trained and capable, thereby enhancing customer satisfaction and organisational reliability.

text: 100% of merchant services representatives shall be able to successfully perform a follow up action on a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Merchant Services Representatives' Competency in Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I want all merchant services representatives to be able to successfully perform a follow-up action on a dispute case on the first encounter after completing the training course, so that the integrity and trust in our services are maintained, ensuring fairness and benefiting customers by providing efficient and effective support.

text: The maximum wait time for a user navigating from one screen to another within the Disputes application shall be no more than 5 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Prompt Navigation to Maintain User Trust and Satisfaction

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I should experience a maximum wait time of no more than 5 seconds when navigating between screens, to ensure that my time is valued, my experience is seamless, and my trust in the application’s reliability and efficiency is maintained.

text: The Disputes application shall support 350 concurrent users without any degradation of performance in the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Performance Scalability for Fair User Access

**Description**: As a developer, I want the Disputes application to support 350 concurrent users without any degradation of performance, to ensure that all users have fair access to the system. By maintaining optimal performance for all, we uphold principles of justice and fairness, ensuring no individual is disadvantaged due to system overload and guaranteeing that everyone can interact with the application effectively.

text: The Disputes application shall be available 24x7x365  with the exception of the following scheduled maintenance windows.  Monday \96 Saturday 3:00am to 4:00am EST Sunday 1:00amd to 5:00am EST
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Continuous Accessibility of Disputes Application

**Description**: To uphold the principles of justice and fairness, the Disputes application should be accessible to users 24x7x365, except for predefined maintenance windows. This ensures that users have continuous and reliable access, minimizing potential disruptions that could impact their ability to resolve disputes in a timely manner. It also aligns with the principle of trust by guaranteeing system reliability and clear communication regarding maintenance periods.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Statement Database. The Statement Database provides the transaction details to the Disputes System. All transaction details must be obtained from the Statement Database
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Responsible Data Integration for Disputes Application

**Description**: As a developer ensuring ethical compliance, I want the Disputes application to transparently interface with the Statement Database to obtain transaction details, ensuring that the data integration process is clear, well-documented, and accountable. This will enable users to trust the accuracy and integrity of the transaction details provided by the Disputes System.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Information Database. The Cardmember Information Database provides detailed information with regard to a cardmember. All cardmember detail information must be obtained from the Cardmember Information Database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Interface with Cardmember Information Database

**Description**: As a developer, I want the Disputes application to interface with the Cardmember Information Database in a manner that respects the privacy and dignity of cardmembers, ensuring that their detailed information is securely accessed and handled. This will be achieved by implementing robust security measures, ensuring transparency about how data is used, and maintaining accountability for protecting cardmember information. This approach will also promote trust and fairness, preventing misuse or unauthorized access to personal data.

text: The Disputes applications shall interface with the Merchant Information Database. The Merchant Information Database provides detailed information with regard to the merchant. All merchant detail information shall be obtained from the Merchant Information Database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Responsible Merchant Information Handling

**Description**: As a developer, I want the Disputes application to interface transparently and responsibly with the Merchant Information Database to ensure that all merchant details are accurately and ethically obtained. This includes maintaining transparency about the data sources, ensuring the reliability and integrity of the information, and safeguarding the privacy and dignity of the merchants by handling their data responsibly.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Letters application.  This will allow the Disputes application to request letters as part of the dispute initiation and dispute follow up process. All letter requests must be sent to the Print Letter Utility application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Transparent and Responsible Integration for Dispute Communication 

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes application, I need the integration with the Letters application to be transparent and responsibly managed. This will ensure that all letter requests during the dispute initiation and follow-up process are clearly communicated, with proper audit trails and accountability measures. Additionally, these requests must be securely and efficiently routed to the Print Letter Utility, preserving user privacy and data integrity while supporting clear and open communication.

text: The Disputes application shall interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.  This will allow the Disputes application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant\92s accounts. All adjustment requests must be sent to the Cardmember Posting and Billing System.
ethical_us:
**Title:** Ensure Ethical Adjustment Requests

**Description:** As an ethical developer, I want the Disputes application to interface with the Cardmember Posting and Billing System transparently and responsibly. This integration will allow the application to request adjustments to cardmember and merchant accounts, ensuring that all adjustments are accurate, fair, and communicated clearly to all parties involved. Additionally, I will uphold the principles of non-maleficence and privacy by ensuring that all data processing respects user privacy and does no harm.

text: The Disputes application shall ensure that only users with the appropriate access level are allowed to initiate dispute requests.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Appropriate Access Levels for Dispute Initiation  

**Description**: As an application user, I want to ensure that only individuals with the appropriate access level can initiate dispute requests, so that privacy and data security are maintained, trust is upheld, and the rights and dignity of all users are respected.

text: Only users with Update access must be able to initiate dispute requests.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Role-Based Access for Dispute Initiation 

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that only users with Update access can initiate dispute requests, in order to uphold the principles of responsibility and trust by preventing unauthorized access and ensuring that users are accountable for dispute resolutions.

text: The Disputes application shall ensure that only authorized users are allowed to logon to the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Authorized User Access Control

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that the Disputes application allows only authorized users to log in, to protect user data and privacy, maintain system integrity, and build trust by preventing unauthorized access or misuse of the application.

text: All authorized users  once authenticated must be able to logon to the Disputes System
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure Access for Authorized Users

**Description**: As a user, I want to be able to log in to the Disputes System only after my identity has been authenticated, ensuring that my personal data is protected, access is controlled, and trust in the system's security is maintained. This will uphold my privacy and ensure responsible and transparent handling of access.

text: The Disputes System shall generate a User Report that details any new users that have been added and any changes to an existing user\92s access level. The report will be reviewed for auditing purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Accountable User Management Report

**Description**: As a stakeholder, I need the Disputes System to generate a comprehensive user report detailing any new users added and changes made to existing users' access levels so that I can ensure transparency and maintain accountability through regular auditing.

text: All additions of new users and modifications to user\92s access shall be recorded on the User Report.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accountability in User Access Modifications  

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want all additions of new users and modifications to user access to be recorded on the User Report so that there is a transparent and accountable record of changes, ensuring responsibility and traceability within the system.

text: If a user account is revoked  it can only be re-instantiated by the System Administrator.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Account Reinstatement Authorization by System Administrator

**Description**: As a measure to ensure Transparency, Responsibility, and Trust, if a user account is revoked, it can only be reinstantiated by the System Administrator. This maximizes accountability and integrity in the system, ensuring that only authorized personnel can restore access, thereby preventing unauthorized reinstatements and ensuring responsible handling of user accounts.

text: Only the System Administrator shall be able to reset a revoked user logon account
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restricted Access to User Account Reset

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want exclusive rights to reset a revoked user logon account to ensure privacy, maintain system security and trust, uphold user dignity, and prevent unauthorized or potentially harmful access.

text: The Disputes application shall manipulate and view business data. Users will not have direct access to data files or databases.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Data Handling in the Disputes Application

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes application to manipulate and view business data without granting direct access to data files or databases to ensure privacy, security, and non-maleficence, thus protecting sensitive information and maintaining user trust.

text: All updates to data files or database must be initiated from the Disputes System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Centralized Data Update System for Disputes

**Description**: As a user, I want all updates to data files or databases to be controlled exclusively through the Disputes System to ensure data integrity, enhance trust, and maintain accountability, thus promoting transparency and responsibility in managing data disputes.

text: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Legal Compliance in Disputes Application

**Description**: As an ethical requirement, the Disputes application must ensure transparency and accountability by conforming strictly to the legal requirements specified by the Merchant Operating Regulations. This includes clearly communicating the legal guidelines to all users, providing explainable processes for dispute resolution, and maintaining high levels of integrity and trust throughout the application’s operation.

text: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Compliance with Merchant Operating Regulations

**Description**: As a responsible and trustworthy disputes system developer, I want to ensure that all business rules in the Disputes System are in compliance with the Merchant Operating Regulations so that we maintain trust, uphold fairness, and ensure proper accountability to all stakeholders involved.

text: The Disputes application must conform to the legal requirements as specified by Regulation E and Regulation Z that govern credit card disputes processing.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compliance with Legal Regulations for Credit Card Disputes

**Description**: As a developer, I want the Disputes application to align with Regulation E and Regulation Z, which govern credit card disputes processing, to ensure we responsibly meet legal standards, protect user privacy and data, and maintain user trust.

text: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compliance with Regulation E and Z in Disputes System

**Description**: As an ethical AI engineer, I want all business rules specified in the Disputes System to be in compliance with the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z, so that users' financial rights are protected, ensuring fairness, transparency, and minimizing potential harms.

text: The Disputes application must maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case.  This ensures a complete audit trail if questions arise later on with regard to a particular dispute case.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain Detailed History of User Actions on Dispute Cases for Accountability

**Description**: As an ethical requirement, the Disputes application must maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case to ensure transparency and accountability. This complete audit trail will allow for thorough reviews and investigations if questions arise later, ensuring that responsibilities are clear and decisions can be scrutinized fairly.

text: All actions that modify an existing dispute case must be recorded in the case history.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Recording Modifications to Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a responsible system, all actions that modify an existing dispute case must be transparently recorded in the case history to ensure accountability, maintain trust, and uphold justice and fairness.

text: The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accessible Disputes System for All Users

**Description**: As a developer, I want to design the Disputes System to be equally accessible by both internal and external users, ensuring fairness and inclusivity to allow all users to effectively resolve disputes.

text: The Disputes System must prevent users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Access to Dispute Cases 

**Description**: As a responsible financial institution, we must ensure that the Disputes System prevents users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base, to protect the privacy and dignity of individuals and maintain trust.

text: The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Fair Dispute Case Entry System

**Description**: As a user, I want a dispute case entry system that is transparent and easy to understand, ensuring that I receive real-time responses. This system should be designed to ensure fairness and justice for all users by providing clear, unbiased communication and equal treatment in the dispute resolution process.

text: The Disputes System must provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Role-Based Access for Dispute System

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to implement role-based access controls, so that different roles have appropriate levels of access for initiating and following up on dispute cases, ensuring transparency, accountability, and the protection of user privacy.

text: The Disputes System shall provide view access capability for authorized users of the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized User Access in Dispute System

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that only authorized users have the capability to view disputes in the system, in order to uphold principles of privacy and trust by protecting sensitive information from unauthorized access.

text: The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access to Dispute System Updates

**Description**: As an application stakeholder, I want the Dispute System to provide update access capability exclusively for authorized users to ensure transparency, uphold privacy, maintain justice and fairness, and build trust by preventing unauthorized alterations and protecting sensitive information.

text: The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Trust and Fairness in Disputes System

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to allow me to select disputable transactions based on the age of the transaction from a user-friendly interface and initiate a dispute process (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) so that I can trust that the system is fair, transparent, and protects my financial rights without discrimination.

text: The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Users with the Ability to Initiate a Single Dispute for Multiple Transactions

**Description**: To foster transparency and trust, the Disputes System should allow users to initiate a single dispute case for multiple transactions associated with a single merchant. This feature ensures ease of use and efficiency, enabling users to address their concerns in a streamlined manner without unnecessary complexity.

text: The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request.   As part of ticket retrieval creation process the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request.  The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Creation of Ticket Retrieval Requests 

**Description**: As a user, I want to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request in the Disputes System, ensuring that I am prompted to enter all required information to verify the transaction's validity. The system should guarantee transparency by clearly explaining the necessary information, ensure privacy by protecting personal data, and uphold fairness by providing all users equal opportunity to dispute transactions without bias.

text: The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests.  The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio. A portfolio consists of documentation that would provide proof of a purchase such as the documentation that is received from a car rental agency that is more than a sales receipt.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Ticket Retrieval Requests

**Description**: As a user, I want to have the ability to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests (original receipt, copy of the receipt, or a portfolio) in the Disputes System. This functionality should ensure transparency in processing, maintain privacy of personal data, and guarantee that the retrieval process is fair and free from discrimination, allowing users to retrieve necessary documentation responsibly and with integrity. The system must ensure that these requests do not jeopardize user autonomy or privacy and that all data is handled securely to build trust.

text: The Disputes System must prevent external users from requesting original receipts. Requests for original receipts are restricted to internal users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restrict External User Access to Original Receipts for Privacy Protection

**Description**: As a developer, I want the Disputes System to restrict the ability to request original receipts to internal users only, to ensure the privacy and confidentiality of sensitive information, thereby protecting external users from potential misuse of their personal data and adhering to ethical principles of privacy and non-maleficence.

text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information
ethical_us:
**Title**: Confirmation of Ticket Retrieval Request

**Description**: As a user creating a ticket retrieval request in the Disputes System, I want to receive a confirmation containing relevant information so that I can trust that my request has been properly logged and is being processed transparently.

text: The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request.  The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Handling of Chargeback Requests

**Description**: 
As a user of the Disputes System, I should be able to create or initiate a chargeback request transparently and responsibly. The system must prompt me to enter the required information in a clear and understandable manner to ensure non-maleficence and avoid errors or misunderstandings. A printed chargeback notification should be sent transparently to the merchant, indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid, ensuring the privacy and dignity of all parties involved. The overall process should be fair and just, ensuring no party is unfairly disadvantaged, thereby fostering trust in the system.

text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information
ethical_us:
**Title**: Confirmation of Chargeback Request Creation

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes System, I want to receive a confirmation notification upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation should include all relevant details about the request to ensure transparency and give me the information necessary to understand, verify, and trust the chargeback process.

text: The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Prevent Duplicate Dispute Requests

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to ensure that duplicate dispute requests are prevented 100% of the time, so that the system operates fairly and efficiently, ensuring justice and fairness. This also builds trust in the system by demonstrating reliability and preventing unnecessary complications for users.

text: The Disputes System shall accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction.  The list of possible reason codes must be derived based on the type of transaction and the industry that the merchant belongs to  according to the business rules defined for the Disputes System.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Fair Dispute Reason Codes for Transactions

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to transparently and accurately provide a list of possible reason codes for a given transaction, ensuring these are derived based on the type of transaction and the merchant's industry. This ensures the reason codes are fair, understandable, and follow predefined business rules, promoting trust and justice in dispute resolution.

text: The Disputes System must provide the ability to view existing dispute cases.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent View of Existing Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a user, I want the Disputes System to transparently provide the ability to view existing dispute cases, ensuring that the information is clear, understandable, and accessible while maintaining confidentiality and fairness.

text: The Disputes System must provide Search functionality.  The search method must include the ability to search by (1) the dispute case number  (2) the merchant account number  (3) the cardmember account number and (4) the issuer number.  In addition to the above criteria  the search functionality must further allow the user to limit the results of the search by a date range  the type of dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification)  the case status (open  closed or all) and the dispute reason code.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Search Functionality for Disputes System

**Description**: The search functionality within the Disputes System must ensure accessibility and transparency for users, enabling them to find dispute cases efficiently by various criteria such as dispute case number, merchant account number, cardmember account number, and issuer number. Additionally, users should have the capability to refine search results by date range, dispute type, case status, and dispute reason code. This search function must be designed to respect users' privacy and act in accord with principles of justice and fairness to ensure that all search processes are non-discriminatory and do not compromise the autonomy and dignity of individuals involved.

text: A list of all disputes cases that meet the entered search criteria must be provided to the user.  The list of cases must differentiate the type and/or status of the case by color -coding the line item in the list.  For example all open cases will be yellow and all closed cases will be gray.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Display of Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a user, I need a list of all dispute cases that meet the entered search criteria, distinguishing between different types and statuses of cases through color-coding (e.g., yellow for open cases and gray for closed cases). This feature should maintain transparency by clearly communicating the status of each case, uphold justice and fairness by ensuring that no cases are misrepresented, protect the privacy of the data involved, and foster trust by providing an accurate and reliable display of case statuses.

text: The Disputes System shall provide the users the ability to view the history of all activities that have occurred on the dispute case.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent Activity History for Dispute Cases

**Description**: Ensure that users have the ability to view the complete history of all activities that have occurred on their dispute cases. This transparency will enhance user trust by providing clear and understandable records of all actions taken, fostering accountability and reinforcing the system's integrity.

text: The Dispute System shall provide the users with the ability to follow up on a dispute case via follow-up actions.  The list of available follow up actions for a given dispute case must be filtered by the status of the case and the access level of the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Provide Transparent and Fair Follow-up Actions for Dispute Cases

**Description**: As a user involved in a dispute case, I want to have the ability to follow up on my dispute case through clearly defined and accessible follow-up actions. The list of available follow-up actions must be transparently filtered by the status of my case and my access level, ensuring fair process and equitability for all users. This promotes trust, justice, and transparency in the dispute resolution system.

text: The Disputes System shall record the name of the user and the date for any activity that creates or modifies the disputes case in the system.  A detailed history of the actions taken on the case  including the date and the user that performed the action must be maintained for auditing purposes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Maintain Auditable Dispute Case Histories

**Description**: As a user of the Disputes System, I want the system to record my name and the date for any activity that creates or modifies a disputes case, as well as maintain a detailed history of actions taken on the case, including the date and the user who performed the action, to ensure accountability and transparency for auditing purposes. This ensures that all actions are trackable, fostering responsibility and trust while safeguarding user privacy and ethical standards.

text: For any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a case such as the disputes aging process  a case activity will be generated.  Upon the next logon the user that initiated the dispute case must be notified that a systematic action has occurred on the dispute case.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Users of Automated Actions on Dispute Cases 

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want the system to generate a case activity for any systematic (non-user initiated) action that occurs on a dispute case, and notify the user who initiated the dispute case upon their next logon, to promote transparency, responsibility, and trust in the system's operations.

text: All letter requests must be formatted according to guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Letter Requests Adhere to Standardized Formatting Guidelines

**Description**: As a user handling letter requests, I need to ensure that all letter requests are formatted according to the established guidelines specified by the Print Letter Utility system, in order to maintain transparency, consistency, and to uphold the responsibility of providing clear and understandable communication. This consistent formatting will also help in preserving user dignity by acknowledging the importance of delivering well-structured and professional correspondence, thus fostering trust in the system.

text: Any disputes cases that have been closed for over 6 months must be purged from the online disputes database.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Retention for Closed Disputes

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that any dispute cases that have been closed for over six months are purged from the online disputes database to protect users' privacy and uphold their dignity by safeguarding their personal data from unnecessary retention. This action will also build trust by demonstrating our commitment to responsible data management practices.

text: The product must support Internet Explorer 5.5 and above.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Cross-Browser Compatibility for All Users

**Description**: In the interest of justice and fairness, the product must support Internet Explorer 5.5 and above to ensure that all users, regardless of their browser preference or technological limitations, can access and utilize the product effectively. This addresses the principle of inclusivity by considering users who may be using older browsers, thereby promoting equal access and preventing discrimination based on technology.

text: The product must support Mozilla Firefox 1.0 and above.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accessibility and Inclusivity Across User Browsers
