**Title**: Ensure Fair Participation in Game Assignment

**Description**: As a game organizer, I want the system to automatically make players assigned to an ongoing game unavailable for selection from the list of players, ensuring fairness in player participation and preventing any player from being chosen for multiple games simultaneously.

text: The product shall allow a user to remove himself or herself from the list of players at any time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User Removal from Player List

**Description**: As a user, I want to have the ability to remove myself from the player list at any time, to ensure my freedom and autonomy are respected and my personal data privacy is maintained. This capability will enhance trust in the system by giving me control over my participation and information.

text: The product shall make inactive players unavailable for selection from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair Player Selection Integrity

**Description**: As a person responsible for maintaining the integrity of player selection, I want inactive players to be made unavailable for selection from the list of players, so that the selection process remains fair and accurately represents active participants.

text: The product shall remove players who have been inactive for 24 hours from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fairness in Player Activity Monitoring

**Description**: As a product owner, I want the system to transparently remove players who have been inactive for 24 hours from the list of players, ensuring the process is fair, communicated clearly to users, and respects their autonomy and dignity, so that active players can have a better gaming experience without feeling disadvantaged by inactive participants.

text: The product shall allow a player to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Respectful Game Initiation

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to allow me to initiate a game by selecting another available player from the list, ensuring that this process is transparent, respects the privacy and dignity of the other player, and promotes a fair and respectful interaction.

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall display a defensive grid to each player
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Defensive Grid Display for Players

**Description**: As a player, I want the game to display a defensive grid at the initiation of a game so that I can clearly understand my position and options within the game. This ensures transparency in gameplay, allowing all players to have an equal understanding of the game's initial setup and avoiding any confusion or ambiguity that could impact the fairness of the game.

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall display an offensive grid to each player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Displaying Offensive Game Grid with Ethical Considerations

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to ensure that once a game is initiated, the product shall display an offensive grid to each player in a manner that respects user autonomy, promotes transparency about game rules, ensures fairness by providing equal advantages, and sustains trust by maintaining data privacy and system integrity.

text: The product shall prevent a player from viewing the offensive or defensive grids of the other player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Player Grids Privacy

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to implement features that prevent a player from viewing the offensive or defensive grids of the other player, in order to respect privacy, maintain fair play, and ensure the trust and autonomy of all players.

text: Once a game is initiated  the product shall allow each player to position their 5 ships on their respective defensive grids.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair Positioning of Ships in Game

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to ensure that each player has an equal and transparent opportunity to position their 5 ships on their respective defensive grids once the game is initiated, to promote a fair and just gaming experience.

text: The product shall allow a player to position ships horizontally on their grid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Fair Gameplay Positioning 

**Description**: As a user, I want the product to allow a player to position ships horizontally on their grid to ensure that all players have equal opportunities for strategic placement, promoting justice and fairness in gameplay.

text: The product shall allow the player to position ships vertically on their grid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Fair Gameplay Mechanics

**Description**: The product shall allow the player to position ships vertically on their grid, ensuring justice and fairness by offering uniform gameplay mechanics across all players.

text: The product shall allow the player to position ships diagonally on their grid
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fairness in Ship Placement

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to allow players to position ships diagonally on their grid to ensure fairness and equal gameplay opportunities, so that no player has an unfair advantage based on ship placement constraints.

text: The product shall prevent the player from overlapping ships on their grid.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Prevent Ship Overlapping on Player Grid

**Description**: As a developer, I want the product to prevent players from overlapping ships on their grid to ensure fairness and integrity in the gameplay, thereby fostering trust and a fair gaming environment for all users.

text: When both players have positioned their 5 ships on their defensive grids  the product shall define the status of each player for the first turn.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Fair Turn Allocation for Players

**Description**: As a player, I want the status determination for the first turn after both players have positioned their ships to be conducted fairly and equitably, ensuring that no player has an undue advantage, thus promoting justice and fairness in gameplay.

text: For each turn  the product shall identify one player as offensive status and one player as defensive status.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair Player Status Assignment in Game Turns

**Description**: As a game developer, I want the product to ensure that the assignment of offensive and defensive statuses to players each turn is executed transparently, fairly, and consistently. This will prevent any biased or unfair advantage, thereby maintaining trust and fairness for all players.

text: The product shall maintain the status of each player for a turn  either offensive or defensive.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair Representation of Player Status

**Description**: As a developer, I want the product to transparently maintain and display the status of each player (offensive or defensive) during a turn, ensuring that players have a clear and understandable view of their roles to promote fairness and trust in the game dynamics.

text: At the start of each turn  the product shall notify each player of his or her status.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Players of Status at Start of Turn

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that at the start of each turn, the product notifies each player of their status to promote transparency and uphold the autonomy of the players by keeping them informed and enabling informed decision-making throughout the game.

text: For each turn  the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Shot Definition 

**Description**: As an offensive player, I want the product to clearly explain how to define a shot for each turn, ensuring that the process is transparent, understandable, and easy to follow, so I can make informed decisions during gameplay.

text: For each shot  the product shall examine the defensive grid of the defensive player to determine whether the shot was a hit or miss.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accurate and Fair Shot Assessment

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to transparently and fairly examine the defensive grid of the defensive player to determine whether the shot was a hit or miss, ensuring the process is understandable and free from bias, thus promoting justice and fairness, and building trust in the game's integrity.

text: For each shot  the product shall notify the players whether the shot was a hit or miss.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Notify Players of Shot Outcome

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to implement a feature that transparently notifies players whether their shot was a hit or miss, so that players can understand the outcome of their actions, maintain trust in the system, and have an enjoyable gaming experience without any ambiguity.

text: For each shot  the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Transparent Marking of Shots in Defensive Grid

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently and accurately mark each shot as a hit or miss on the defensive grid, ensuring fairness and allowing players to trust the accuracy of the game's results. This will prevent any form of manipulation or unfair advantage and provide clear explanations for the shot results, promoting responsibility and integrity in gameplay.

text: For each shot  the product shall mark the shot as a hit or miss on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accurate and Transparent Hit/Miss Marking

**Description**: As a product designer, I want the system to accurately and transparently mark each shot as a hit or miss on the offensive grid of the offensive player. This ensures that the game results are clear and verifiable, thereby enhancing user trust and promoting fairness by providing a clear and understandable outcome for each action.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall notify the players that the ship was sunk.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Notification of Sunk Ship

**Description**: As a game developer, I want the system to transparently notify all players when a ship is sunk, ensuring clear communication and understanding of the game status to maintain trust and fairness among players.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Fair Game Representation upon Sinking a Ship

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to transparently mark a ship as sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player when a hit result sinks the ship, ensuring fairness and an accurate representation of the game's state for both players.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall indicate the type of ship sunk on the defensive grid of the defensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Notification of Sunk Ships

**Description**: As a game developer, I want to ensure that when a player's hit results in sinking a ship, the type of ship sunk is indicated on the defensive grid of the defensive player transparently and responsibly. This feature aims to maintain fairness and trust in the game, ensuring that both players have a clear and accurate understanding of game events, while preserving the integrity of the gameplay and fostering a respectful competitive environment.

text: When the hit results in sinking a ship  the product shall mark the ship as sunk on the offensive grid of the offensive player.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Marketing of Game Results

**Description**: Ensure that when a hit results in sinking a ship, the app marks the ship as sunk on the offensive grid of the offensive player, while ensuring transparent communication and trust.

text: If the shot was marked as a hit  the product shall allow the offensive player to define a shot.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Handling of Shot Confirmation and Authorization

**Description**: As an offensive player, I want the system to transparently inform me if a shot was marked as a hit, ensuring that the process is clearly explained and easily understandable. The system should also confirm my authorization to define the shot while ensuring fairness and integrity in the decision process. This prevents any manipulation or unfair advantage, aligning with principles of transparency, justice and fairness, and responsibility.

text: If the shot was marked as a miss  the product shall change the status of the offensive player to defensive
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Fair Play in Shot Outcome Categorization
**Description**: To maintain justice and fairness, the product must accurately change the status of the offensive player to defensive if a shot is marked as a miss. This ensures an unbiased transition of player roles and prevents any form of unfair advantage during the gameplay, promoting an equitable experience for all participants.

text: If the shot was marked as a miss  the product shall change the status of the defensive player to offensive
ethical_us:
**Title**: Fair Transition of Player Roles Based on Accurate Performance Tracking

**Description**: Ensure that any changes in player status from defensive to offensive (or vice versa) are based on accurate and transparent tracking of their performance. The system should provide a clear explanation of how the decision is made, respect the players' dignity by maintaining fairness in role assignment, and maintain transparency to foster trust among users. This process should be designed to avoid any harm to the player's integrity and ensure that the system operates within a fair and just framework.

text: The product shall continue to assign turns until the game is ended.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Fair Turn Assignment in Game

**Description**: Ensure that the game fairly continues to assign turns to all players until it is ended, maintaining transparency in turn assignments and reinforcing trust in the game’s fair play mechanics. This includes safeguarding against biases and ensuring that all players have an equal opportunity to participate, thereby promoting justice and fairness in the gameplay experience.

text: The product shall end a game when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player\92s ships  which had not been previously marked as sunk.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Fair and Transparent Game Conclusion

**Description**: As a developer, I want the game to ensure that when a hit by the offensive player results in sinking the last of the defensive player's ships, which had not been previously marked as sunk, the game should transparently and fairly conclude. This ensures that the defensive player's dignity and trust are maintained by providing a clear and unbiased end to the game. Additionally, the game system should record and display this action accurately to both players for accountability and responsibility.

text: The product shall allow a player to end a game at any time during the game.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Autonomy in Game Termination

**Description**: As a user, I want the ability to end a game at any time to maintain my freedom and autonomy, ensuring I have control over my gaming experience and am not forced to continue against my will.

text: When a game is ended  the product shall notify the players that the game is ended.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Notification of Game Conclusion

text: The notification of the game ending will include the reason the game is ended (i.e.  a player has won the game or a player has ended the game).
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Game End Notifications

This promotes transparency and builds trust among players by providing understandable and honest communication regarding game outcomes.

text: When a game is ended  the product shall allow each player to identify himself or herself as an available player in the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Player Identification Post-Game

text: When a game is ended  the product shall allow each player to remove himself or herself from the list of players.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Player Autonomy Post Game

**Description**: As a game development team, we want to ensure that at the end of every game, each player has the autonomy to remove themselves from the list of players, thus respecting their freedom and maintaining their privacy.

text: The system shall be easy to use by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors must be able to accomplish any system task within 2 minutes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Usability and Efficiency for Callers and Supervisors

**Description**: As a system user (caller or supervisor), I need the system to be intuitive and efficient, allowing me to complete any necessary task within 2 minutes. This ensures respect for my time and dignity, promotes freedom and autonomy by making the system accessible, and fosters trust in the system's reliability and usability.

text: The system shall be easy to learn by callers and supervisors. Callers and supervisors shall learn how to use the system within 10 minutes.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ease of Learning for Callers and Supervisors

**Description**: As a responsible organization, we will design the system to be easy to learn for both callers and supervisors. It is crucial that users can familiarize themselves with the system within 10 minutes to avoid frustration and ensure efficient operations. This promotes user autonomy and respects their dignity by valuing their time and effort. Additionally, making the system easy to learn contributes to trust by demonstrating the system's reliability and usability.

text: The system shall be responsive. At the DePaul TeleServices Center  when a supervisor uses the system to view a callers schedule  the system response time must be no more than 2 seconds 90% of the time and no more than 5 seconds the rest of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Responsive Interaction for Supervisors Viewing Caller Schedules

**Description**: As a responsible AI system, we must ensure that the response time for supervisors viewing caller schedules at the DePaul TeleServices Center is efficient, thereby reducing operational delays and fostering trust. Specifically, our system shall respond within 2 seconds 90% of the time and no more than 5 seconds the rest of the time, maintaining transparency in performance and upholding the dignity and autonomy of both supervisors and callers by providing a consistently reliable and swift system.

text: On a 56k connection  the system response time for all operations must be no more than 6 seconds 90% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Accessible and Fair User Experience

**Description**: As a user on a 56k internet connection, I need the system's response time for all operations to be no more than 6 seconds 90% of the time, so that I can access services efficiently and fairly, regardless of my internet speed. This ensures justice and fairness by preventing discrimination based on internet connectivity, and upholds the dignity of users by valuing their time and providing consistent levels of service.

text: On a 112k connection or faster  the system response time for all operations must be no more than 3 seconds 90% of the time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Experience Across Network Speeds

**Description**: As a responsible developer, I want to ensure that the system's response time is consistently fast (no more than 3 seconds 90% of the time) on a 112k connection or faster, in order to provide a fair and dignified user experience, regardless of network speed.

text: The system must be available for use between 7:00AM and 11:59PM all days of the year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring System Accessibility and Reliability

This requirement supports dignity by respecting users' time and need for reliable service and ensures justice and fairness by providing equal access to the system across different times and days.

text: The product shall be internet browser independent.The product must run using Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Browser Independence and Compatibility

**Description**: To ensure fairness and accessibility, the product shall be compatible with multiple internet browsers, including Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator. This promotes justice by providing equal access to users, regardless of their browser choice, and supports transparency by ensuring the product's usability is not dependent on a single platform.

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can advertise empty time slots.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Restrict Advertisement of Empty Time Slots to Supervisors for Fair Access Control 

**Description**: To ensure justice and fairness, only supervisors will be permitted to advertise empty time slots. This restriction will also reinforce responsibility and trust, ensuring access control policies are strictly followed and user roles are respected.

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can enter a caller\92s schedule.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.
ethical_us:

This measure ensures privacy and data protection for callers by restricting access to authorized personnel only, thereby upholding the principles of responsibility, privacy, and trust.

text: The product shall ensure that only supervisors can view schedule of all callers.The product must ensure that supervisors are allowed to access advertise empty time slots.

Furthermore, the system should permit supervisors to access and advertise empty time slots. This will ensure responsibility and trust by restricting sensitive information access to authorized personnel only and ensuring that supervisors can manage resources efficiently without compromising individual privacy.

text: The interface shall have a simple look. In the interface and usability survey  90% of beta testers must report that the interface is adequately simple.

text: The product shall provide Monitoring Services.The product shall be easy for System Administrators and DBAs to use after two weeks of usage.

This ensures user autonomy by allowing staff to effectively manage and monitor systems independently, while promoting trust through reliable performance without extensive training. text: The product shall provide Error Tracking Services.The product shall help the System Administrators and DBAs to resolve transaction errors 99% of the time.

Additionally, the error tracking service should be sustainable, respectful of all users' dignity, and uphold justice and fairness in its error resolution methodologies.

text: The product shall provide Portals.The product shall help System Administrators to analyze the transactions with ad-hoc reporting and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)

The portal should ensure the transparency of each transaction and maintain clear explainability of the data and metrics presented. Additionally, the portal must be designed to ensure fairness, preventing any bias in transaction analysis and reports, and must uphold user privacy and data protection to build trust and respect for user dignity.

text: The product shall provide Asynchronous Messaging.The product shall provide asynchronous messaging to enable parallel processing and reduce the overhead in communications
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Trust and Privacy in Asynchronous Messaging

**Description**: As a user, I want asynchronous messaging to enable parallel processing and reduce communication overhead while ensuring my trust and privacy. The messaging system should protect my personal data and be reliable, secure, and effective, so I can communicate without concerns about my information being compromised or misused.

text: The product shall provide Multi-threading and Load Balancing.The product shall provide multi-threading technology as well as load balancing to overcome data load spikes and traffic.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Efficient and Fair Resource Utilization Through Multi-threading and Load Balancing

**Description**: To promote fairness and ensure the system's efficiency, our product shall incorporate multi-threading and load balancing technologies. These measures will help in distributing data load spikes and traffic evenly, preventing resource overcrowding and enabling equitable access to system resources for all users. This solution will also foster trust by maintaining system performance and stability under various loads and helping avoid potential system overloads that could cause harm or inconvenience to users.

text: The product shall process messages within 2 seconds.The product shall have a maximum message processing time of 2 seconds
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Efficient and Timely Message Processing 

**Description**: As part of our commitment to user trust and autonomy, the product shall process messages within 2 seconds to provide a seamless and efficient user experience. Quick message processing ensures that the application remains responsive and reliable, which respects users’ time and fosters trustworthiness in the technology. Additionally, maintaining a maximum message processing time of 2 seconds minimizes unnecessary delays, thereby avoiding frustration and ensuring fair access to the service for all users.

text: The product shall poll the system for messages every second.The product shall poll the system for new messages at a maximum of every 1 second.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Polling Frequency for System Messages

**Description**: The product shall poll the system for new messages at an interval that respects system resources and user privacy, ensuring it does not inadvertently cause harm or reduce system performance (Non-maleficence and Sustainability). The polling frequency must be designed to maintain transparency on how data is accessed and ensure that user autonomy is not compromised (Transparency and Freedom and Autonomy). Moreover, the polling mechanism shall be implemented with justice and fairness in mind, ensuring that it does not favor specific users or messages at the expense of others (Justice and Fairness).

text: The product shall provide Dynamic Change Support and Transparent resource addition.The product shall support Transparent Resource addition and Dynamic Change support to provide scalability and avoid service interruptions of more than 1 day.
ethical_us:

text: The product shall be robust.The product shall have fault avoidance based on standards adoption.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Robust and Reliable Systems through Standards Adoption

**Description**: As an ethical developer, I want to ensure that the AI product is robust and has fault avoidance by adhering to established standards, so that it operates reliably without causing harm, thereby maintaining trust, ensuring justice and fairness, and upholding the dignity and safety of all users.

text: The product shall be robust with fault tolerance.The product shall have fault tolerance by using recovery technique compensatory transaction and routing around failures.
ethical_us:

This will ensure that the system operates reliably and maintains user trust by minimizing the potential for harm due to system failures.

text: The product shall be able to process all transactions.The product shall process minimum of 1 million transactions per year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Transaction Processing

text: The product shall be platform independent.The product shall enable access to any type of development environment and platform.
ethical_us:

This ensures fairness and inclusivity by providing equal opportunities for developers across various operating systems and tools, and enhances autonomy by allowing users to choose their preferred environments without constraints.

text: The product shall interface CSR and Datastream.The product shall exchange messages between CSR and EAM on a real time basis without any direct interfaces between two systems.
ethical_us:

text: The product shall continue to operate during upgrade  change or new resource addition.The product shall be able to continue to operate with no interruption in service due to new resource additions.
ethical_us:

**Description**: As a system user, I want the product to continue to operate without interruption during upgrades or when new resources are added, ensuring that my access to services is consistent and reliable, thereby upholding trust and responsibility.

text: The product shall be updated on a regular basis.The product will have a new major feature introduced every six months and quarterly maintenance releases every six months.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Regular and Responsible Product Updates

**Description**: As an ethical AI organization, we commit to updating our product regularly, with a new major feature introduced every six months and quarterly maintenance releases every six months. This ensures ongoing stability, security, and enhanced user benefits while maintaining transparency and trust in our development processes. These updates will be communicated clearly to users, ensuring they are informed and can fully understand the changes and improvements being made.

text: The product shall operate with every platform.The product shall accommodate any new technology without any change in its architecture.
ethical_us:

This ensures equitable access and prevents exclusion, thereby maintaining fairness and autonomy for all users. Additionally, by designing the product to accommodate new technology without changes to its architecture, we promote sustainability and reduce the potential for technical debt that might lead to future complications or harm, in alignment with the principles of non-maleficence and responsibility.

text: The product shall have security.The product shall provide authentication  and authorization.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Robust Security and Access Control Measures

**Description**: To build trust and uphold the principle of non-maleficence, the product must be designed with robust security features, including comprehensive authentication and authorization mechanisms. This will help protect user data against unauthorized access and potential misuse, thus ensuring users' privacy and security are not jeopardized.

text: The product shall have audit capabilities.The product shall store messages for a minimum of one year for audit and transaction tracking purposes.

This will enable effective transaction tracking and accountability for actions taken, while being transparent about data usage and retention policies.

text: The system shall use IBM and CCR branding standards. The interface must have one IBM logo and one CCR logo.

text: The interface must summarize the data in a fashion that\92s appealing to CCR management. Every report type must have at least one high level summary shown in the results dashboard/interface

**Description**: Design the interface to summarize data in a manner that is both appealing and easily understandable to CCR management. Ensure that every report type includes at least one high-level summary displayed in the results dashboard/interface, enhancing transparency and making data easily accessible and interpretable for informed decision-making.

text: The system must use a point and click interface. 100% of all selection and navigation functionality must be able to be activated/selected by either a mouse or a keyboard
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Accessible Point and Click Interface

**Description**: As a user, I need a point and click interface where 100% of selection and navigation functionality can be activated using either a mouse or a keyboard, ensuring accessibility for all users, including those with disabilities, thereby upholding principles of justice and fairness, and respecting human dignity.

text: The interface shall be easy to use. 90% of users should be able to successfully use the system to generate a report on their first use. The interface should adhere to IBM usability standards.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Usability and Accessibility of Interface

**Description**: As a user, I want the interface to be easy to use so that 90% of users can successfully generate a report on their first attempt, adhering to IBM usability standards, to promote freedom and autonomy, uphold human dignity, and build trust in the system. The design should consider all users, including those with disabilities, to ensure justice and fairness in access and usability.

text: Reports must be easy to generate. Reports must be generated within one button click and exported within one button click (after selecting the report)
ethical_us:
**Title**: Effortless Report Generation

**Description**: As a user, I want the ability to generate and export reports with minimal complexity and within a single button click, in order to ensure transparency in data processing, maintain trust in the system's efficiency, and uphold the user's autonomy and dignity by making the process straightforward and efficient.

text: A user shall be able to use the system without instruction after a short amount of time. After one use a user should understand and remember 90% of the system usage and navigation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Enhancing Usability for Seamless User Experience

**Description**: As a user, I should be able to use the system intuitively and efficiently after a short initial interaction, ensuring that I can remember and navigate 90% of the system's functionalities independently. This enhances my autonomy and dignity by making the system more accessible and easy to use, while also fostering trust in its reliability and user-centric design.

text: All CCR users shall receive training before the WCS system is deployed. One training session will be held for 100% of CCR users before system deployment (based on a CCR user being available)
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Training and Competence Before System Deployment

**Description**: As part of our commitment to transparency, responsibility, and trust, all CCR users shall receive comprehensive training before the WCS system is deployed. A mandatory training session will be organized, ensuring that 100% of CCR users are well-informed and competent in using the system prior to its implementation, contingent upon their availability. This initiative aims to foster understanding, reduce the risk of errors, and promote effective and responsible use of the system.

text: The WCS system shall use appropriate nomenclature and terminology as defined by the Corporate Community Grants organization. All interfaces and reports will undergo usability tests by CCR users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Usability and Appropriateness of Terminology in WCS System

**Description**: 
As a requirement, the WCS system must adhere to the nomenclature and terminology standards set by the Corporate Community Grants organization. This promotes transparency and trust by ensuring that all language used is consistent and easily understandable by the stakeholders. Furthermore, to respect the principle of dignity and ensure justice and fairness, all interfaces and reports generated by the system will undergo usability testing by CCR users to identify and address any potential usability issues, ensuring that the system is accessible, fair, and easy to use for all.

text: The WCS system shall be available at all times as long as IBM\92s internal intranet W3 is accessible. The WCS system will be available 95% of the time IBM\92s internal intranet W3 is available.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring System Availability and Reliability for Continuous Access

**Description**: As an organization, we commit to ensuring the WCS system is available and reliable, maintaining a 95% uptime in alignment with IBM's internal intranet W3 availability. This commitment upholds the principles of trust and responsibility by providing dependable access to necessary resources, ensuring that stakeholders can rely on the system for their critical functions without unnecessary interruptions.

text: The WCS system shall have the ability to connect other designated WCS databases currently not included in the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Trust and Privacy in WCS Database Integration

**Description**: As a developer responsible for integrating additional WCS databases, I want the system to ensure that during the connection process, all data transfer and access adhere to stringent privacy policies and security protocols in order to build trust with users and protect their sensitive information.

text: The WCS system shall have the ability to include data for regions outside the United States and be accessed by users outside of the United States if approved by CCR management.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Inclusion of International Data and Users for WCS System

**Description**: As a responsible organisation, we need to include data for regions outside the United States and allow access to users outside the United States upon CCR management approval, ensuring this process adheres to ethical principles of privacy, transparency, justice and fairness. This will guarantee that international data and user interactions are managed ethically, protecting privacy while promoting equitable access and clarity in decision-making.

text: The WCS system shall be run in a Windows environment. The WCS shall be accessed by users through the Internet on an IBM computer running a Windows 2000 or above operating system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Platform Accessibility and Compatibility for WCS System 

**Description**: As a user, I want the WCS system to be accessible through the Internet on an IBM computer running Windows 2000 or above, to ensure compatibility and accessibility while maintaining a transparent and trustworthy user experience. This alignment respects user autonomy and promotes fairness by providing consistent access across specified platforms.

text: The Brio portion of the WCS system must be able to export files in spreadsheet form (Microsoft Excel and Lotus 1-2-3 formats).  Brio will provide buttons in the user interface that produce/export reports in .xls or .123 file formats.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical File Export in Multiple Formats

**Description**: As a user of the WCS system, I need the Brio portion of the system to export files in multiple spreadsheet formats (Microsoft Excel and Lotus 1-2-3) through easily accessible buttons, ensuring that this functionality respects user privacy, maintains data integrity, and promotes transparency by clearly documenting the data export process.

text: The WCS system must run queries to the WCS databases once again (on a specified day) to update the available data available to CCR users. Queries must be made to external databases for data refresh once a week.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Data Refresh for CCR Users

**Description**: As a developer, I want the WCS system to run queries to the WCS databases and external databases to update the available data for CCR users, ensuring transparency by clearly communicating when and how data updates occur, and maintaining data privacy and security during the update process. This should be done on a specified day each week to uphold the principles of trust, privacy, and responsibility.

**Ethical Principles Addressed**:
- **Transparency**: Clearly communicate the data update schedule and processes.
- **Trust**: Ensure data updates are reliable and secure.
- **Privacy**: Protect personal data during updates.
- **Responsibility**: Developers and stakeholders are accountable for the proper execution and integrity of the data refresh process.

text: The system shall only be accessed by authorized Corporate Community Grants (CCR) employees. Users must be authenticated using their IBM intranet user name and password.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access and Authentication for CCR Employees

**Description**: As a CCR employee, I want the system to require authentication using my IBM intranet user name and password, ensuring that only authorized personnel can access the system. This will maintain data privacy, uphold security, and build trust by protecting sensitive information from unauthorized access.

text: The WCS system shall not allow automatic logins by any user. Cookies containing WCS login information about a user will not be stored on a user\92s computer.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Secure and Privacy-Respecting Logins

**Description**: As a responsible developer, I want the WCS system to prohibit automatic logins and prevent the storage of cookies containing login information on a user's computer to ensure that user privacy and system security are upheld, thus fostering trust and non-maleficence.

text: Each team owner will need to use a username and password in order to be authenticated to reach the team owner\92s page
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Authentication for Team Owners

**Description**: As a system administrator, I want to ensure that each team owner uses a username and password for authentication to access their team owner’s page, to protect their privacy, maintain the security of their data, and build trust by safeguarding sensitive information.

text: The Commissioner will be the only authorized user per league to adjust league settings.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Exclusive Commissioner Access Control Over League Settings

**Description**: As a system designer, I want to ensure that only the designated Commissioner is authorized to adjust league settings in order to maintain transparency, responsibility, and trust by preventing unauthorized changes and ensuring accountable management of league configurations.

text: Each page shall contain a navigation menu which shows the index into which the current page is contained.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Navigation and User Orientation

**Description**: As a user, I want each page to contain a navigation menu that clearly shows the index and the location of the current page within the structure, so that I can easily understand where I am within the website. This promotes transparency and enhances the ease of navigation, ensuring a better user experience and clear communication of information.

text: Each page shall contain a similar format with action items in one location and navigation buttons in a different location.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Consistent Page Layout for User Clarity

**Description**: As a developer, I want each page to contain a similar format with action items in one location and navigation buttons in a different location to ensure transparency and understandability for users, enhancing their trust and autonomy in navigating the system.

text: The message board shall contain the 5 most recently posted messages on the league page. The messages will contain up to the first 150 characters of the message.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Display Recent Messages with Privacy and Fairness Considerations  
**Description**: As a system, the message board should display the 5 most recently posted messages on the league page, containing up to the first 150 characters of each message. The implementation should ensure that user privacy is maintained by not displaying any sensitive information and that the moderation process is fair to all users, preventing any discriminatory or harmful content from being posted.

text: A new user shall be able to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Accessible and Efficient Navigation for New Users 

**Description**: As a new user, I need to navigate through the league and team pages within 30 seconds of reaching the start-up page, ensuring ease of use and enhancing my experience without causing frustration. This maintains user dignity by respecting my time and effort, promotes trust through a reliable and efficient system, and supports beneficence by providing a positive and accessible interface.

text: Users shall be able to reach the \91add\92  \91drop\92  and \91trade player\92 pages with one click from the team owner\92s page.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Promote Ease of Navigation for Responsible User Interaction

**Description**: Ensure that users can access the "add", "drop", and "trade player" pages with one click from the team owner's page, thereby enhancing seamless user interaction and autonomy. This design choice respects the user's autonomy by providing an intuitive and efficient navigation experience while maintaining transparency about available actions and operations.

text: Users shall be able to view at least 25 NFL player statistics and points on each page.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Transparent Display of NFL Player Statistics 

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that users can view at least 25 NFL player statistics and points on each page in a transparent and unbiased manner, so that the data presented is clear, trustworthy, and free from any form of discrimination or unfairness, ensuring users can make informed decisions based on accurate and equitable information.

text: The application shall ask the user to confirm dropping a player or trading a player before performing the action.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User Autonomy and Consent in Player Actions

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to ask for confirmation before dropping or trading a player, to ensure that I have control over these significant actions and to prevent any unintentional mistakes.

text: The application shall be able to complete every user transaction within one fourth of a second of receiving the request over the network.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely and Fair Processing of User Transactions

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to complete every transaction within one fourth of a second of receiving the request over the network, ensuring that my experience is efficient and that no user is unfairly disadvantaged by delays. This helps in building trust and supports fairness in the service provided.

text: The application shall have a downtime of at most 10 minutes per year.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Minimal Downtime for User Reliability

**Description**: As a user, I want the application to have a downtime of at most 10 minutes per year, so that I can trust and rely on the system's availability and effectiveness, ensuring that my interaction with the technology is smooth and uninterrupted. This upholds the principles of trust, non-maleficence, and responsibility by maintaining operational integrity and minimizing disruption to users' activities.

text: The application shall run on a web application server.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Secure and Accessible Web Application Deployment

**Description**: As an application developer, I want the application to run on a robust and secure web application server to ensure transparency and trust by providing a reliable, understandable, and explainable system, maintain non-maleficence by avoiding harm through security vulnerabilities, uphold responsibility for the security and integrity of the system, protect the privacy of users' data, and support the autonomy of users by providing a stable and competent platform.

text: A primary database will be used to store cached data for active users.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Privacy and Security of Cached User Data

**Description**: As a developer, I want to ensure that the primary database used to store cached data for active users incorporates robust encryption and access controls, so that users' personal data remains private and secure at all times.

text: A secondary database will be used to store historical statistics and data.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Management of Historical Data Storage

**Description**: As a data manager, I want the secondary database used for storing historical statistics and data to uphold ethical principles by ensuring the security and privacy of personal data, maintaining transparency in data management practices, avoiding harm, and promoting fairness, so that users' trust is maintained, their autonomy and dignity are respected, and the system contributes positively to society while being sustainable.

text: Application updates shall occur between 3AM and 6 AM CST on Wednesday morning during the middle of the NFL season.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Scheduling of Application Updates

**Description**: As a developer, I want to schedule application updates between 3AM and 6AM CST on Wednesday mornings, ensuring minimal disruption to users' activities during the NFL season, thereby respecting their autonomy, minimizing any potential inconvenience, and maintaining user trust by informing them of these updates.

text: New System version releases shall be released at the beginning of each NFL season.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Timely Release of System Updates  

**Description**: As a user, I want system updates to be released at the beginning of each NFL season to ensure I benefit from the latest improvements while maintaining the integrity and reliability of the system with minimal disruptions.

text: The RFS system should be available 24/7  especially during the budgeting period. The RFS system shall be available 90% of the time all year  and 98% during the budgeting period. 2% of the time  the system will become available within 1 hour of the time that the situation is reported.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Reliable Availability of RFS System

**Description**: As an organization aiming to support users effectively, we ensure the availability of the RFS system 24/7, particularly during critical budgeting periods. The system will maintain a minimum uptime of 90% throughout the year and 98% during budgeting periods. Any downtime will be addressed and the system reestablished within 1 hour of reporting, to uphold trust and responsibility by minimizing interruptions to users' work and decision-making processes.

text: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum hardware requirements prior to implementation. Minimum Hard Disk Space:  400MB.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Adequate Hardware for User Workstations 

**Description**: As a responsible IT administrator, I want to ensure that 98% of user workstations meet the minimum hardware requirements, including having at least 400MB of hard disk space, prior to implementation. This is to ensure that the implementation process runs smoothly, respects user autonomy by preventing disruptions to their work, and upholds justice and fairness by providing all users with the necessary resources to perform their tasks effectively.

text: 98% of the user workstations shall meet the minimum software requirements prior to implementation: Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0. Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1. Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Workstations Meet Software Requirements Ethically

**Description**: As an IT administrator, I want to ensure that at least 98% of user workstations meet the minimum software requirements (Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1, Microsoft Internet Explorer Web Controls) before implementation, to maintain system integrity and avoid potential harm (non-maleficence). This will also ensure transparency about system requirements, protect user privacy by securing their data, and cultivate trust in the system's reliability and effectiveness.

text: The RFS system should be able to easily interface with the BDW environment  in order to load the data. \95
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Data Integration with Transparency and Privacy

**Description**: As a system integrator, I want the RFS system to interface with the BDW environment in a manner that ensures data transparency and user privacy, so that users can trust that their data is handled responsibly and securely, without compromising their personal information.

text: Changes to revenue and expense formulae must be applied to the RFS system  every year  prior to the budgeting process start. Revenue and expense formulae will be updated within one week of their receipt  after which 2 weeks will be allotted to testing of the budget calculations  to be conducted jointly by the project development team and PCG Finance.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Update and Testing of Revenue and Expense Formulae

**Description**: Ensure that changes to revenue and expense formulae are applied to the RFS system annually before the budgeting process begins. The updates should be completed within one week of receipt, followed by a two-week period for joint testing of budget calculations by the project development team and PCG Finance. This process will be conducted with a focus on transparency, responsibility, and fairness, ensuring clear communication, accurate results, and accountability throughout.

text: New branches/complexes/districts/regions and revenue/expense accounts added to the BDW  must be reflected in the RFS system. 100% of the entities (mentioned above) available as of October month-end  will be loaded into the RFS system  prior to the budget start process.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Accuracy and Fairness in Financial Reporting Systems

**Description**: As part of our commitment to justice and fairness, it is crucial that any new branches, complexes, districts, regions, and revenue/expense accounts added to the Business Data Warehouse (BDW) are accurately and promptly reflected in the Reporting and Financial System (RFS). This ensures that 100% of the entities available as of October month-end are loaded into the RFS system prior to the budget start process, preventing any discrepancies and guaranteeing equitable representation and accurate financial reporting across all entities.

text: Only authorized user shall access the RFS system. ONLY users that exist in the UAS system  with the RFS system assigned to their role(s)  shall access the RFS system and use it.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized User Access to the RFS System

**Description**: To uphold privacy and responsibility, we must ensure that only authorized users can access the RFS system. This involves verifying that users exist in the UAS system and have the RFS system assigned to their roles. This practice safeguards user data and maintains system integrity, thereby fostering trust and security.

text: User access should be limited to the permissions granted to their role(s) Each level in the PCG hierarchy will be assigned a role and users will be assigned to these roles. Access to functionality within RFS system is dependent on the privileges/permission assigned to the role..
ethical_us:
**Title**: Role-Based Access Control for Ethical User Management

**Description**: As a user of the RFS system, I should have access limited solely to the permissions granted to my specific role(s) within the PCG hierarchy. This measure ensures that access to functionality within the system is dependent on the assigned privileges and permissions, thereby upholding principles of privacy, responsibility, and justice and fairness by preventing unauthorized access and enhancing system integrity.

text: The product must comply with the intranet page standards and requirements of ENET Securities. 95% of the product look & feel will be approved by the Architecture group  prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected and approved within one month of product release.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Compliance with Intranet and Architectural Standards

**Description**: As a developer, I want the product to comply with the intranet page standards and requirements of ENET Securities to ensure transparency and adherence to organizational regulations. To maintain trust and responsibility, 95% of the product’s look and feel will be approved by the Architecture group prior to implementation, and the remaining 5% will be corrected and approved within one month of product release. This process ensures that the product upholds standards and maintains stakeholder confidence.

text: The intranet pages should display appropriately in all resolutions  from 800x600 and higher. The display of all the pages will be correct in 95% of the resolutions  prior to implementation. The remaining 5% will be corrected within a week of notification of the incorrect display.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Universal Accessibility of Intranet Pages

**Description**: As a user, I want intranet pages to display appropriately across all resolutions (from 800x600 and higher), ensuring a correct display in at least 95% of the cases prior to implementation, and swiftly addressing any display issues within a week of notification. This supports the principles of justice and fairness by providing equal access to information for all users, regardless of their device resolution.

text: The users should be able to easily use the system to successfully complete their budgets  within the stipulated time for completion. With a week of training prior to product implementation  98% of the users shall complete their budgets within the stipulated time.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly Budget Management System

**Description**: As a finance manager, I want a budget management system that is user-friendly and easily learnable within a week of training so that 98% of users can successfully complete their budgets within the stipulated time. This will ensure that the system respects users' autonomy, upholds justice and fairness by being accessible to all, and fosters trust by reliably enabling users to meet their financial goals.

text: The product interface should be fast. The response time of the product interface should not exceed 2 seconds 90% of the time. For 10% of the time  the response time should not be more than 10 seconds.not be more than 10 seconds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Efficient and Reliable User Interface

**Description**: As a user, I want the product interface to be efficient and reliable, thereby ensuring that the response time does not exceed 2 seconds 90% of the time and stays within 10 seconds for the remaining 10%, so that the technology respects my time and provides a seamless experience. This promotes trust and beneficence, ensuring the system works effectively and benefits users by saving them time and enhancing usability.

text: The system shall operate on Unix and Windows operating systems.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Cross-Platform Operation

**Description**: Ensure that the system operates efficiently and securely on both Unix and Windows operating systems, promoting fairness and accessibility by supporting diverse user environments. This will uphold user trust, respect user autonomy, and enhance the overall user experience without discrimination based on their choice of operating system.

text: The system shall be evoked by typing “pine” into a command or shell prompt.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring User Autonomy in System Activation

**Description**: As a user, I want to evoke the system by typing "pine" into a command or shell prompt so that I can maintain control over when and how the system is activated, ensuring my freedom and autonomy are respected.

text: The system shall use the SMTP mail protocol.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensuring Secure and Compliant Email Communication

**Description**: As a responsible developer, I want the system to use the SMTP mail protocol with enhanced security measures to ensure privacy, non-maleficence, and maintain user trust by protecting email communication from unauthorized access and ensuring data integrity.

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a send and receive operation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethics of Sending and Receiving Operations

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to support sending and receiving operations transparently and responsibly, ensuring that data privacy is maintained, no harm is caused, and operations are executed fairly and securely to build trust and uphold user dignity.

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a send only operation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Operation Integrity and User Consent

**Description**: The system shall support the ability to perform a send-only operation in a way that ensures transparency by clearly informing users about the nature and consequences of a send-only operation. It shall also ensure non-maleficence by guaranteeing that no unintended data is sent without the user's informed consent. Additionally, the system shall uphold the principles of privacy and responsibility by safeguarding user data during the send-only operations, ensuring that the data is transmitted securely and used in accordance with privacy regulations.

text: The system shall support the ability to perform a receive only operation.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Trustworthy Data Reception

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to support a receive-only operation, so I can trust that my data will be transparently received and protected without unauthorized modifications. This ensures that data integrity is maintained and aligns with the principles of transparency and trust.

text: The system shall use a text-based interface to display a listing of available mail.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Understandable Mail Listing Interface  
**Description**: As a user, I want a text-based interface to display a listing of available mail that is transparent and easy to understand, so that I can be fully aware of the emails I receive and trust that the information displayed is accurate and comprehensible.

text: The system shall have a help system that offers tips and explanation for each screen and each item on the screens upon demand.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Help System Provision

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a help system that offers tips and explanations for each screen and each item on the screens upon demand so that I can understand how to use the system better and ensure transparency in its functionalities.

text: The system shall allow a text search that users may use to find mail messages.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent and Fair Mail Message Search

**Description**: As a user, I want the text search feature for mail messages to be transparent and fair. The system should be designed to clearly explain how search results are generated, ensuring that the process is understandable. Additionally, it must ensure fairness by not prioritizing or discriminating against certain messages based on the content, sender, or other attributes. This promotes trust, justice, and maintains the dignity of users.

text: The system search feature should support the use of regular expressions in search.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Regular Expression Search Support

**Description**: As a user, I want the system search feature to support the use of regular expressions so that I can perform more precise and effective searches, ensuring that the system operates transparently and fairly, while respecting privacy and building trust through accurate and responsible data handling.

text: The system shall provide an option to withdraw money.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Withdrawal Transparency and User Autonomy

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to provide a clear and understandable process to withdraw money, ensuring full transparency of the transaction and preserving my freedom and autonomy to manage my finances.

text: The system shall query the user for the amount of money.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Transparent and Trustworthy User Queries for Financial Information 

**Description**: As a developer, I want the system to clearly and transparently inform the user about why it is querying them for the amount of money, ensuring the reason is easily understandable, and assure them that their financial information will be securely handled to build trust.

text: The system shall query the user for the account type.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Account Type Query Respects User Privacy and Autonomy

**Description**: As a software developer, I want the system to query the user for the account type in a way that respects their privacy and autonomy, ensuring that it collects only necessary information while providing clear explanations for why this information is needed and how it will be used, so that users can make informed decisions and feel secure in their interactions with the system.

text: The system shall validate the amount is available in the user’s account before releasing funds to the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fund Release Validity and User Financial Security

**Description**: As a responsible and trustworthy financial application, the system shall validate that the amount requested is available in the user's account before releasing funds. This ensures non-maleficence by preventing potential overdrafts or financial harm to the user, maintains trust through reliable operations, promotes user autonomy by allowing them to manage their finances confidently, and guarantees fairness by applying consistent financial checks for all users.

text: The system shall validate the amount is a multiple of $20.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Validate Transaction Amount for Equity 

**Description**: Ensure that the system validates transaction amounts to be multiples of $20 to prevent conversion discrepancies, maintain transaction fairness, and provide a transparent and understandable financial process for the user.

text: The system shall debit the user’s account upon withdrawal of funds.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Withdrawal and Account Debit

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to debit my account upon withdrawal of funds in a transparent and secure manner, ensuring that my privacy and personal data are protected. The system should perform this action responsibly, avoiding any potential harm, and provide clear communication about the transaction to maintain trust and fairness.

text: The system shall be able to issue a specific amount of money to the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Transparent Financial Transactions

**Description**: As a system developer, I want the system to issue a specific amount of money to the user in a transparent and fair manner, ensuring that users understand the transaction process. The system must protect the user's financial data privacy, work reliably, and be accountable in case of discrepancies. This will help maintain user trust and ensure transactions do not inadvertently harm or disadvantage any user.

text: The meeting scheduler system shall be able to select a participant as an important participant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethically Highlight Important Participants

**Description**: As a user of the meeting scheduler system, I want to be able to select a participant as important, ensuring that this selection is communicated transparently to all involved parties. This feature should respect privacy, maintain fairness, and avoid any form of unjust discrimination, while also ensuring that the highlight positively impacts the meeting's effectiveness and productivity.

text: The meeting scheduler system shall cancel a meeting due to canceling of an important participant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Meeting Cancellation Due to Key Participant Unavailability

**Description**: As a user, I want the meeting scheduler system to transparently communicate and cancel a meeting if an important participant cancels their attendance, ensuring that all involved parties are promptly informed of the change and the reasons behind it.

text: The meeting scheduler system shall reschedule a meeting to support conflict resolutions.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Meeting Rescheduling for Conflict Resolution 

**Description**: As a user requiring a transparent and trustworthy meeting scheduler system, I want the system to reschedule a meeting to support conflict resolutions, ensuring that no one’s autonomy, privacy, or dignity is compromised in the process, and that fairness and justice are upheld for all participants.

text: The meeting scheduler shall be accessed from the Web.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Secure and Transparent Access to Meeting Scheduler

**Description**: As a user requiring access to the web-based meeting scheduler, I want to ensure that my access is secure and that the operations of the scheduler are transparent. This includes clear communication on how my data is being used, steps taken to protect my privacy, and the security measures in place to prevent unauthorized access.

text: The meeting scheduler system may (optionally) automatically propose another meeting if current meeting is canceled by an important participant.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Rescheduling for Important Participants

**Description**: As a user of the meeting scheduler system, I want the option for the system to automatically propose another meeting if the current meeting is canceled by an important participant, ensuring that the rescheduling process is transparent and respects the autonomy and schedules of all involved parties. This feature should promote fairness by considering the needs and importance of each participant's time and facilitate trust through reliable communication and scheduling integrity.

text: The meeting scheduler system may provide the “meeting initiator” a summary of the scan of “potential meeting participants” showing available “time slots” and schedule conflicts as a means of informing the “meeting initiator” of the overall results of the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Meeting Scheduling Summary

**Description**: As a meeting initiator, I want the meeting scheduler system to provide a transparent summary of the potential meeting participants' available time slots and schedule conflicts. This will ensure I am fully informed of the system's overall scheduling results, allowing for fair and conflict-free meeting planning.

text: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include an agenda for a meeting proposal.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Fair and Transparent Meeting Agenda Inclusion

**Description**: As a user of the meeting scheduler system, I want the system to include an agenda for a meeting proposal in a transparent and fair manner, ensuring that all participants have equal opportunity to review and contribute to the agenda, and that their privacy and autonomy are preserved.

text: The meeting scheduler system may suggest a “virtual meeting” for available “time slots” if no location is available or feasible for the meeting.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Virtual Meeting Suggestion

**Description**: As a responsible meeting scheduler system, I want to suggest virtual meetings for available time slots when no physical location is feasible or available. This ensures that meetings can still take place without encumbering participants' ability to attend, promoting autonomy and minimizing potential harm or inconvenience. Additionally, by facilitating virtual meetings, we enhance sustainability by reducing the need for travel and contribute to overall societal beneficence by making collaboration more flexible and accessible.

text: The meeting scheduler system may be able to include a list of required equipment for a meeting proposal.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Equitable Access to Required Meeting Equipment

**Description**: As a system developer, I want the meeting scheduler system to include a list of required equipment for a meeting proposal to ensure that all participants have equitable access to necessary resources, thereby promoting fairness and reducing potential barriers to effective participation.

text: A meeting scheduler system will temporarily reserve the “time slots” for the proposed meeting.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical Time Slot Reservation for Meeting Scheduler

**Description**: As a user, I want the meeting scheduler system to temporarily reserve "time slots" for proposed meetings in a transparent and fair manner, ensuring that no conflicts arise with other scheduled activities, maintaining privacy of all participants' calendars, and allowing users the autonomy to accept or decline the proposed times without undue pressure.

text: A meeting scheduler system will inform the “potential meeting participant” of the meeting.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Transparent Meeting Notification

**Description**: As a potential meeting participant, I want to be clearly informed about the meeting details, so that I have full transparency and can make an informed decision about attending.

text: The system must be easy to use by both managers and chefs such that they do not need to read an extensive amount of manuals.
ethical_us:
**Title**: User-Friendly and Intuitive System for Managers and Chefs

**Description**: Design the system to be highly intuitive and user-friendly, ensuring that managers and chefs can operate it efficiently without the need for extensive manuals or training. This approach upholds the principles of dignity by respecting the users' time and autonomy, and trust by demonstrating reliability and ease of use. The design should facilitate smooth operation and reduce the potential for user frustration or error, aligning with the principle of beneficence.

text: The system must be quickly accessible by both managers and chefs.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Equitable and Efficient Access for Managers and Chefs  
**Description**: As an ethical requirement, the system must facilitate quick and efficient access for both managers and chefs. This ensures justice and fairness by providing equal accessibility to all user groups, promoting a trustworthy environment where all roles can operate effectively without any undue delay.

text: The system must be intuitive and simple in the way it displays all relevant data and relationships.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Clear and Understandable Data Display

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to display all relevant data and their relationships in an intuitive and simple manner, so that I can easily understand and interpret the information without confusion. This ensures transparency and promotes trust in the system.

text: The menus of the system must be easily navigable by the users with buttons that are easy to understand.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure User-Friendly and Intuitive Menu Navigation 

**Description**: As a system designer, I want the menus of the system to be easily navigable by users with buttons that are simple and intuitive, thus fostering trust and dignity by ensuring that all users, regardless of their technical proficiency, can operate the system effectively and without frustration.

text: All the functions of the system must be available to the user every time the system is turned on.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure System Availability Consistently

**Description**: As a user, I want all functions of the system to be available every time it is turned on to ensure reliability and trust. This consistency respects my autonomy by allowing me to plan and depend on the system for my needs without interruptions.

text: The calculations performed by the system must comply according to the norms set by the user and should not vary unless explicitly changed by the user.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Consistent and User-Defined Calculations

**Description**: As a user, I want the system's calculations to consistently comply with the norms I have set and only change when explicitly altered by me, ensuring transparency, responsibility, and justice in the results.

text: The client should agree to EULA before using our software.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Client Informed Consent for EULA Agreement

**Description**: As a software application, I want to ensure that the client fully understands and agrees to the End User License Agreement (EULA) before using our software. This includes presenting the EULA in an understandable manner and confirming client consent, thereby upholding transparency, respect for client autonomy, and trust.

text: All Web pages generated by the system shall be fully downloadable in no more than 10 seconds over a 40KBps modem connection.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Accessible and Efficient Web Page Downloads

**Description**: As a user, I want web pages to be fully downloadable within 10 seconds over a 40KBps modem connection, ensuring a fair and just experience for all users, including those with limited internet speeds. This upholds the principles of justice and fairness by providing equal access to information regardless of internet connectivity and promotes trust by consistently delivering efficient performance.

text: Responses to queries shall take no longer than 7 seconds to load onto the screen after the user submits the query.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Timely and Trustworthy Responses to User Queries

**Description**: As a user, I expect the system to respond to my queries within 7 seconds to ensure promptness and reliability. This level of responsiveness maintains my trust in the system's effectiveness, upholds my autonomy by respecting my time, and contributes to a seamless and dignified user experience.

text: The system shall display confirmation messages to users within 4 seconds after the user submits information to the system.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Timely Confirmation of Submitted Information

**Description**: As a user, I want the system to display confirmation messages within 4 seconds after I submit my information, ensuring transparent communication about the successful receipt of my data, thereby fostering trust and maintaining my autonomy by providing timely feedback.

text: Users shall be required to log in to the Cafeteria Ordering System for all operations except viewing a menu.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ethical User Authentication for Cafeteria Ordering System

**Description**: As a user, I want to be required to log in to the Cafeteria Ordering System for all operations except viewing a menu, ensuring privacy and security of my personal information while maintaining the ability to freely access public information.

text: Patrons shall log in according to the restricted computer system access policy.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Ethical Access Control for Patrons

**Description**: As a developer, I want to design and implement a login system for patrons that adheres to the restricted computer system access policy, ensuring transparency in login procedures, upholding user privacy, and maintaining the integrity and security of the system. This will ensure that patrons' personal data is protected and their access is governed by fair and just policies, thereby building trust and responsibility.

text: The system shall permit only cafeteria staff members who are on the list of authorized Menu Managers to create or edit menus.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Secure Menu Management

**Description**: As a cafeteria staff member, I want only authorized Menu Managers to have the ability to create or edit menus to ensure the security and integrity of our menu offerings and prevent unauthorized changes. This helps protect our customers and maintain trust in our services by ensuring that all menu changes are done responsibly and fairly.

text: Only users who have been authorized for home access to the corporate Intranet may use the COS from non-company locations.
ethical_us:
**Title**: Ensure Authorized Access to Corporate Intranet from Outside Locations
